name: atom-image-paste

1.2.0.name: atom-image-paste
1.2.0.description: Pastes images from your clipboard into atom. Supports various filetypes and custom image directories.

use_subfolder.title: Save images in subfolder
use_subfolder.description: If checked the images will be saved in a subfolder. You can either set your own folder or choose from the presets

use_selected_text.title: Use selected text as file name
use_selected_text.description: If checked the currently selected text will be the filename, along with the current date

1.1.0.name: atom-image-paste
1.1.0.description: Pastes images from your clipboard into atom. Supports various filetypes and custom image directories.

use_subfolder.title: Save images in subfolder
use_subfolder.description: If checked the images will be saved in a subfolder. You can either set your own folder or choose from the presets

allLettersLowerCase.title: All Letters lowercase
allLettersLowerCase.description: If checked the first letter of the filename will always be lowercase

spacesToUnderlines.title: Spaces to underline
spacesToUnderlines.description: If checked words where the second letter is uppercase won't be put in the normal camelCase. This means all letters being Uppercase will stay that way if the second letter is Uppercase

automaticCamelCase.title: Automatic camelCase
automaticCamelCase.description: The name of the imagefile will automatically be put into to camelCase. The first letter afert a space will be written in uppercas. The first letter of the filename will depend on the setting `First Letter`

readme:
# atom-image-paste
Pastes images from your clipboard into atom. Supports various filetypes and custom image resource directories. Creates `*.png` in current directory by default.

## Supported File Types
* `*.tex`
* `*.md`
